stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes the number of times that the code segment updates  maxValue  after it is initialized to  0?

features.html:
Consider the following class definition.

 

public class Element 
{ 
   private static int maxValue = 0; 
 
   public Element (int value) 
   {
      if (value > maxValue) 
      { 
         maxValue = value; 
      } 
   }
   
   public static int getMaxValue()
   {
      return maxValue;
   }
}

 

The following code segment appears in a class other than Element.  Assume that no other  Element  objects have been created.

 

Element a = new Element(1);
Element b = new Element(Element.getMaxValue());
Element c = new Element(2);
 
if (Element.getMaxValue() == 3)
{
   Element d = new Element(4);
}

choicesHtml: It is never updated because it is declared  static.
It is updated 2 times, first when  a  is created and again when  c  is created.
It is updated 3 times because the code segment creates exactly 3  Element  objects.
It is updated 4 times because the code segment creates exactly 4  Element  objects.
